name: Surendra Neupane, PhD
role: Prominent academician, researcher, consultant, and entrepreneur since 2004, perused his doctorate in consumer psychology.
bio: Dr. Surendra Neupane is a distinguished academician, researcher, consultant, and entrepreneur with extensive expertise in consumer psychology, international business, and contemporary social issues. Dr. Neupane has made significant contributions to academia and industry, seamlessly blending theoretical insights with practical applications. As a prolific researcher, Dr. Neupane's research is characterized by a multidisciplinary approach, published numerous high-impact papers in reputable journals, including Scopus-indexed journals. Dr. Neupane is currently serving as a lecturer where leading courses in Consumer Behavior, Marketing Management, Marketing Research and International Business and serving as a co-supervisor for PhD scholars at Lincoln University College, Malaysia/ Centre of Postgraduate Studies. In addition to academic roles, Dr. Neupane actively mentors doctoral, graduate and postgraduate students as a thesis supervisor. Beyond academia, Dr. Neupane has amassed extensive industry experience as an entrepreneur, successfully managing ventures in industries, e.g., investment, retail, research, consulting, and manufacturing. Moreover, Dr. Neupane's dedication to knowledge dissemination extends to workshops and training programs. Where continuously empower and inspire participants, collaborate with international peers, and contribute meaningfully to the fields of business and social sciences.

name: Rabin Subedi, PhD
role: Prominent academician, researcher, consultant, and entrepreneur since 2004, perused his doctorate in Human Resource Management.
bio: Rabin Subedi is a distinguished academic and professional with over 15 years of experience in teaching and research. He serves as the coordinator of the Department of Management at Lincoln College, affiliated with Tribhuvan University in Kathmandu, Nepal. In this role, he has supervised numerous master's theses and published several articles on human resource management. He holds a PhD in Human Resource Management from Lincoln University College in Malaysia, along with multiple master's degrees. These include a degree in Professional Accounting from the University of Southern Queensland in Australia and a degree in Business Studies from Tribhuvan University in Nepal. His professional journey includes leadership positions such as Chairman and former CEO of Sustainable Appliances Nepal Pvt. Ltd., as well as Founder Director of Sparsha Microfinance Ltd. Rabin is also experienced in student advising and has presented his research at international conferences. He has traveled to various countries, including India, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, and Australia, which has provided him with valuable global insights. His commitment to education and research has made significant contributions to the field of management, positively influencing both academic and professional spheres.

name: Ram Prasad Parajuli, PhD
role: Prominent academician, researcher, consultant, and entrepreneur since 2004, perused his doctorate in consumer psychology.
bio: Ram Prasad Parajuli is a distinguished educator and accomplished scholar in the field of business. He completed his Master's degree from Tribhuvan University, where he demonstrated exceptional dedication to academic excellence. Driven by a thirst for knowledge, Ram Prasad pursued his Ph.D. at DKNM University, where he delved deep into his research interests. His doctoral studies not only expanded his expertise but also solidified his commitment to the world of academia. With a profound passion for teaching, Ram Prasad Parajuli has been imparting his knowledge and insights to students, nurturing the next generation of business leaders. His teaching style is known for its clarity and ability to inspire young minds. Currently he involved with different program of T.U. as a visiting faculty of Dr. K N Modi University, India, Infrastructure university, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, A level program of Cambridge university. In addition to his teaching, Ram Prasad actively contributes to the field through his research, with notable publications and academic engagements and he directly involve in different sector of business activity.

name: Amar Bahadur Thapa, PhD Scholar

name: Binod Nepal, PhD
role: Prominent academician, researcher, and consultant since 2004, perused his doctorate in mathematics.
bio: Dr. Binod Nepal is a dedicated academic leader, researcher, and education expert from Sindhupalchok, Nepal. Born on July 3, 1979, he earned his PhD in Education with a specialization in Mathematics Education from Dr. K.N. Modi University, India. Dr. Nepal has over two decades of experience in teaching, research and capacity-building initiatives across Nepal. He serves as CEO of Evidhya, Director at Opinion Research & Development, lecturer at Koteshwor Multiple Campus and other academic institutions. A creative researcher, he has led studies on education, disaster management, and sustainable development, contributing to policy-making at local, province and national levels. Passionate about empowering communities, Dr. Nepal continues to inspire change through strategic planning, training, and knowledge-sharing.

name: Hari Chandra Khadka
role: Prominent academician, researcher, and consultant since 2004, perused his doctorate in mathematics.
bio: With 13 year's teaching experience in both private and public educational institutions Hari decided to work for a greater cause which led him to become a trainer, facilitator and mentor. He is an accredited facilitator of New Hope International Australia and a Lifetime Member of Council for Mathematics Education (CME), Nepal. He also worked as a Program Director in 'Education for All', a project funded by Swedish Charity and is a Founding Member of Opinion Research and Development, a research and professional development institution. He is also actively involved in teaching, mentoring and supporting mathematics teachers and learners, leading teachers training/workshop, overseeing the curriculum, planning and project management, policy Research and formulation, research and proposal writing including other academic works. He is well experienced in liaising with concerned authorities and is good at maintaining organizational relations.
